testgroup.ptxt: Check manually if the variable geometry control rod is blocked.
testgroup.question: Is the rod blocked?

testgroup.ptxt: At idle speed, with boost pressure control solenoid valve control:
between of 70% and 85% opening cyclic ratio, disconnect the electrical connector of the solenoid valve and check at the same time if the rod controlling the variable geometry blades moves.
testgroup.question: Does the rod move from end stop to end stop?

action.ptxt: The turbocharging control circuit is operating normally.

testgroup.ptxt: Check the condition of the boost pressure control solenoid valve connectors (corrosion, bent pins, etc.). Measure the resistance of the solenoid valve referring to Boost Pressure Control Solenoid Valve Inspection:F9Q .
testgroup.question: Is the solenoid valve in order?

action.ptxt: Replace the boost pressure control solenoid valve.

testgroup.ptxt: Check the electric harness of boost pressure control solenoid valve
testgroup.question: Is there in good condition?

testgroup.ptxt: Reconnect the electrical connector of the boost pressure control solenoid valve.
On the control diaphragm of the variable geometry blades, disconnect the pipe coming from the solenoid valve. Connect a pressure gauge in place of the diaphragm. Engine at idling speed.
testgroup.question: Is the vacuum pressure > 750 mbar?

testgroup.ptxt: Measure the vacuum pressure upstream of the boost pressure control solenoid valve.
testgroup.question: Is the vacuum pressure > 750 mbar?

action.ptxt: Replace the boost pressure control solenoid valve.
Check the vacuum circuit and repeat the test from the vacuum pressure check.
